titleInfo.title: Asymptotics of Certain Short-Range Interactions on Rectifiable Sets and Beyond

mods:mods.abstract: We study the asymptotics of various short-range interactions, namely, minimal Riesz $s$-energy, maximal Riesz $s$-polarization, best packing, and best covering, on sets satisfying minimal smoothness assumptions. In particular, we present the proof of the Poppy-Seed Bagel Theorem for polarization and covering on $(\mathcal{H}_d,d)$-rectifiable subsets of Euclidean space with like Hausdorff measure and Minkowski content. This represents the sealing of a gap in the generality of results that existed between energy and polarization. In practice, we verify the short-range properties of polarization and covering to deduce the first order asymptotic formulas for these quantities, depending in a universal fashion upon $\mathcal{H}_d(A)$. We simultaneously use the short range properties to deduce weak* uniformity of optima in the large configuration limit. Our results are sharp in the following sense: for sets lacking one of the regularity assumptions mentioned above, asymptotics do not depend on $\mathcal{H}_d(A)$ in the same way as stated there. \par The manuscript contains several of our results concerning asymptotics of short-range interactions on metrically separated self-similar fractals. Our primary result is the convergence of hyper-singular polarization on independent fractals. We further detail the proofs of convergence of minimal $s$-energy on lattice fractals along explicit subsequences, and the general non-existence of asymptotics for packing and covering on these sets. Taken with results of Lalley, the negative results provide a characterization of convergence for packing and covering on a given self-similar fractal in terms of the algebraic relationship between its contraction ratios. From the negative results, we also derive non-existence of asymptotics for energy and polarization, for sufficiently large parameter. \par Finally, we discuss some open problems concerning short-range interactions. We draw upon results of Falconer, Gatzouras, and Lapidus to conjecture about the universality of asymptotic formulas for packing and covering on some Minkowski measurable subsets of $\mathbb{R}$ with non-integer Minkowski dimension $d\in(0,1).$ Then, we view the Riesz $s$-energy of $N$-point configurations as a function of $N$ points in Euclidean space, and propose a rigorous study of the dynamics of gradient descent as a means of producing \textit{local} minima of Riesz $s$-energy on spheres. This leads us to conjecture that "bad" starting configurations make up a negligible proportion of all configurations with respect to $N$-fold surface measure.
mods:mods.note: A Dissertation submitted to the Department of Mathematics in partial fulfillment of the requirements for the degree of Doctor of Philosophy.
Energy and Polarization, Fractal Geometry, Geometric Measure Theory, Packing and Covering, Potential Theory, Renewal Theory
Alexander Reznikov, Professor Directing Dissertation; Dmitry Ryvkin, University Representative; Richard Oberlin, Committee Member; Alec Kercheval, Committee Member; Thomas Needham, Committee Member.
